sentence.Network_en: The old man lifted his cardigan to scratch his side.
sentence.Network_cn: 老人撩起开襟毛衣挠了挠身体的一侧。

sentence.Network_cn: 手边备一件薄的套头毛衣或开襟毛衫。
我自己织的这件开襟毛衣。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 19th cent. (Crimean War): named after James Thomas Brudenel, 7th Earl of Cardigan (1797–1868), leader of the Charge of the Light Brigade, whose troops first wore such garments

entry.def: A cardigan is a knitted woollen sweater that you can fasten at the front with buttons or a zip.

means.word_mean: 1. knitted jacket that is fastened up the front with buttons or a zipper
